conclusion: Consider the changes in direction and size of shadows when light source moves.
When the light source moves to the back right, the direction of the shadows will shift.
The shadows will now be cast toward the front left.
The size of the shadows may change depending on the angle and distance of the light source from the objects.
A (Apple): The shadow will move to the front left and may become elongated.
B (Paper): The shadow will shift to the front left and could stretch depending on the paper's orientation.
C (Glass): The shadow will project to the front left and might appear more diffused.
D (Bone): The shadow will extend to the front left and could become longer.
The key changes are in the direction (toward the front left) and potential elongation of the shadows.
The final answer: The shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the front left and may become elongated.
